input.description: The Owala FreeSip Insulated Stainless-Steel Water Bottle with Locking Push-Button Lid easily tackles every thirst. With a built-in, easy-clean straw and a wide-mouth opening, the FreeSip reusable bottle is designed for drinking two different ways: sipping upright through the straw or tilting back to swig from the wide-mouth spout opening. Add in a push-to-open lid and playful colors, and staying hydrated has never been simpler—or more fun. Additional features include double-wall insulated stainless steel that keeps drinks cold up to 24 hours, a carry loop that doubles as a lock, a cup holder-friendly base, and a wide opening for easy cleaning and adding ice. The Owala FreeSip Insulated Stainless-Steel Water Bottle with Locking Push-Button Lid is available in three sizes: 24-Ounce, 32-Ounce, and 40-Ounce. Lid is dishwasher safe; hand wash cup. Not for use with hot liquids. Manufacturer’s limited lifetime warranty.

Analyzing Transformers Optimus Prime figure for 'Action figure play'. Let me apply the 3-step test to each attribute:

11-inch Scale: Step 1 - A smaller or larger figure can still be played with as an action figure. Step 2 - This is SIZE/QUALITY, not mechanism. Step 3 - Basic action figures come in various sizes. NOT a hard constraint.

Robot-to-Truck Conversion: Step 1 - Without conversion ability, this would just be a static robot figure, but it could still function for action figure play (posing, imaginative scenarios). Step 2 - This is a FEATURE that enhances play but isn't the core mechanism. Step 3 - Basic action figures exist without transformation ability. NOT a hard constraint.

6-Step Conversion: Step 1 - The figure could convert in more or fewer steps and still transform. Step 2 - This is COMPLEXITY/QUALITY of the conversion process. Step 3 - Basic transforming toys have varying step counts. NOT a hard constraint.

Cyber Commander Series: Step 1 - This is just a product line designation, doesn't affect core function. Step 2 - This is BRANDING/SERIES. Step 3 - Basic action figures aren't part of specific series. NOT a hard constraint.

Optimus Prime Character: Step 1 - The figure could represent any character and still function as an action figure. Step 2 - This is CHARACTER/THEME choice. Step 3 - Basic action figures can be generic characters. NOT a hard constraint.

All attributes are either QUALITY modifiers, FEATURES, or BRANDING elements. None are fundamental MECHANISMS required for basic action figure play. A basic $1 action figure without any of these attributes would still function for imaginative play.
